content: this so you can clip it onto your shoulder i suggest using contrasting colored yarn so that when it inevitably wears out you know which yarn strands to cut to replace it the body is done now your slug needs its countershading back patch part 1 with blue b yarn row 1 mc 8 stitches 8 - pull only semi tight so you can still run your hook through the center don t tighten it you ll be working in the mc center see how the hook still fits ^^ row 2 increase in every stitch around 16 row 3 1 single_crochet increase x8 24 row 4 increase half_double_crochet half_double_crochet increase half_double_crochet increase slip_stitch slip_stitch mark the half_double_crochet increase with stitch markers this is the front leaving a long sewing tail cut off the working yarn part 2 row 1 mc 6 stitches - pull only semi tight so you can still run your hook through the center don t tighten it you ll be working in the mc center don t continue your stitches in a circle flip the half circle and work back along your previous stitches row 2 chain 1 single_crochet increase x4 9 row 3 chain 3 single_crochet increase 1 single_crochet increase 3 single_crochet 11 row 4 chain 4 single_crochet increase single_crochet increase 4 single_crochet 13 row 5 chain we re going to work in the spaces on the straight edge of the half circle there aren t specific holes for this but fabricate yourself 8 single_crochet and if it helps mark them so you don t lose them the center mc hole can hold 2 st if needed - this is your new row this is why we kept the mc loose just single_crochet across the various holes here row 6 chain 8 single_crochet 8 row 7 chain 1 single_crochet decrease three times in a row 1 single_crochet 5 it curves a bit row 8 chain increase in each st 10 and then flares out again row 9 chain single_crochet across 10 row 10 chain single_crochet across 10 leaving a sewing tail cut the working yarn whip stitch this 10 single_crochet line onto part 1 wrong sides together across from the half_double_crochet stitch markers don t try to make the piece flat it s supposed to look like a z so that it fits better on the slug individual marked stitches lined up and marked in pairs the other side stitching them together don t try to make the piece flat it s supposed to look like a z so that it fits better on the slug z shaped tah-dah nobbles time for the nobbles this is the fussiest part of the pattern but if you persist you will get nice neat nobbles for your doomslug we ll start near the very front of the blue base to the right of the marked half_double_crochet those are the center of the forehead insert your hook from above through a space and out around a post near
